title.rendered: [2023] 250 Top Skillshare Courses of All Time

content.rendered:
Founded in 2010, Skillshare is one of the largest online learning platforms offering courses primarily on design, photography, writing, and other creative activities.

We’ve inspected Skillshare’s catalog, and here’s what we can tell you:

Skillshare boasts more than 41K online courses, with close to 35M enrollments and over 1.1M reviews combined. Over 1.3K of these courses have more than 50 lessons, with their longest course having 313 lessons. 

The platform has 13 million registered learners and over 500K paid subscribers. Their catalog subscription costs $168 per year or $32 per month. The platform’s top-500 teachers earn about $2,000 per month on average.

Since its inception, Skillshare has raised $136.8M; most notably, their raised $66M in 2020 in the wake of the pandemic’s onset, which remains their largest funding round to date.

More Courses

If you don’t find what you need in the course list below, Class Central’s got you covered. Browse our catalog of over 80K courses or visit our thematic collections:

  • Massive List of Thousands of Free Certificates and Badges
  • 1600+ Coursera Courses That Are Still Completely Free
  • 175+ Free Online Writing Courses to Improve Your Skills
  • 750+ Hours of Free LinkedIn Learning Courses with Free Certification
  • 250 Top FREE Udemy Courses of All Time

250 Top Skillshare Courses

Here are some quick stats about the courses:

  • Course enrollments range from 17K to 166K. There are 9 courses with over 100K enrollments.
  • Combined, these courses account for ~7.8 million enrollments, with 32.5K enrollments on average.
  • Almost 40% of the courses focus on illustration and graphic design.
  • Combined, these courses have over 4K lessons.

Finally, here are the top 250 online courses offered on Skillshare:

  • Digital Illustration: Learn to Use Procreate
  • Graphic Design Basics: Core Principles for Visual Design
  • iPhone Photography: How to Take Pro Photos On Your iPhone
